strings.Value: "Your behavior put the lives of your comrades-in-arms and your {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen} in jeopardy. I am sorry, Ekun... but justice demands you be punished. By the power vested in me, I exile you from these lands."
"Ekundayo, you took up arms against your ruler. The punishment for treason is execution, to be carried out immediately. If you have any last words, I will hear them."
"Die, traitor! Watch and know — this is what becomes of those like him!"
"What are you staring at? Get up. Things happen between friends. Just be sure it doesn't happen again..."
"I am sorry it came to this, Ekun. Let's do everything in our power so this never happens again."
{n}As Ekun is just coming to, he looks at you — vacantly, but expectant.{/n}
{n}The ranger chuckles.{/n} "Been dead a long time."
{n}Ekun nods.{/n} "You're fair. Glad I knew you. Farewell."
{n}Ekun's face remains blank.{/n} "I understand. Do what you must..."
{n}Ekun looks at you with surprise.{/n} "I... forgive me, {name}. Lost my head. Won't happen again."
{n}Ekun meets your gaze, then nods.{/n} "You are very kind. I hope I get a chance to pay you back for this..."
"Come talk. When you're in the capital."
